intro: Elytranthe leucosiphon, commonly known as the white-flowered elytranthe, is a perennial herb native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, white or pale pink flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species within its native habitat.
